purpleculture_pinyin:
qián
pincers; pliers; tongs; claw (of animal); to grasp with pincers; to pinch; to clamp; to restrain; to restrict; to gag
клещи; плоскогубцы; щипцы; коготь (животного); хватать клешнями; ущипнуть; зажать; сдерживать; ограничить; заткнуть рот

heisig_chinese_memo: A wicker basket has your metal tools in it, like your favorite the pliers.
Ru_trainchinese: qián: (сущ/глаг) зажимать, брать щипцами; щипцы, клещи, тиски
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: My basket kept breaking so I used my pliers to make a metal one.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " gold " and " gan ", the original meaning is an iron ring that binds the neck, which is a kind of ancient torture instrument. "Shuowen": "With iron, there is a robbery. From the gold, the sound is sweet." "Old Tang Book-Criminal Law History": "It is also a prisoner's tool, including flail, loquat, pincers, and locks, all of which are long and short. Narrow system."

" Tweezers " can mean the penalty of using an iron ring to tie the neck. "The Biography of Ji Bu Luan Bu in the Records of the History": "The tongs of Ji cloth, the brown clothes, and the canton willow car."

" Clamp " also means compulsion. "Huainanzi: Spirit": "Pinch the harmony of yin and yang, and the feeling of compelling life, so lifelong sadness."

" Clamping " also means to clamp and restrain. "Zhuangzi‧ Tianzifang": "My form is unresolved and I don't want to move, and I don't want to speak with my mouth."

" Pliers " can also refer to gripping. "Han Shu·Jiang Chong Biography": "Burning iron with tongs, then force it." Yan Shigu's note: "Use burning iron or tongs, or burn it. Forceps, tongs.

" Pliers " also refer to tools for gripping things. Tang Liu Zongyuan "Qiao Wen": "Glue and clamp, swear to death without change."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " gold " and " gan ", the original meaning is an iron ring that binds the neck, which is a kind of ancient torture instrument.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「甘」聲，本義為束頸的鐵圈，是古代刑具的一種。《說文》：「以鐵有所劫束也。从金，甘聲。」《舊唐書‧刑法志》：「又繫囚之具，有枷、杻、鉗、鎖，皆有長短廣狹之制。」

　　「鉗」可表示用鐵圈束頸的刑罰。《史記‧季布欒布列傳》：「迺髡鉗季布，衣褐衣，置廣柳車中。」

　　「鉗」還表示強迫。《淮南子‧精神》：「鉗陰陽之和，而迫性命之情，故終身為悲人。」

　　「鉗」亦表示鉗持、緘禁。《莊子‧田子方》：「吾形解而不欲動，口鉗而不欲言。」

　　「鉗」也可指夾取。《漢書‧江充傳》：「燒鐵鉗灼，強服之。」顏師古注：「以燒鐵或鉗之，或灼之。鉗，鑷也。」

　　「鉗」還指夾東西的工具。唐柳宗元〈乞巧文〉：「膠加鉗夾，誓死無遷。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「甘」聲，本義為束頸的鐵圈，是古代刑具的一種。

(Simplified: 钳)
Pictophonetic: 甘 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
Chinese: A wicker basket has your metal tools in it, like your favorite the pliers.  
Meaning: pliers
Hanzi: 钳
Story: My basket kept breaking so I used my pliers to make a metal one.
Kind: traditional

從「 金 」，「 甘 」聲，本義為束頸的鐵圈，是古代刑具的一種。《說文》：「以鐵有所劫束也。从金，甘聲。」《舊唐書‧刑法志》：「又繫囚之具，有枷、杻、鉗、鎖，皆有長短廣狹之制。」 「 鉗 」可表示用鐵圈束頸的刑罰。《史記‧季布欒布列傳》：「迺髡鉗季布，衣褐衣，置廣柳車中。」 「 鉗 」還表示強迫。《淮南子‧精神》：「鉗陰陽之和，而迫性命之情，故終身為悲人。」 「 鉗 」亦表示鉗持、緘禁。《莊子‧田子方》：「吾形解而不欲動，口鉗而不欲言。」 「 鉗 」也可指夾取。《漢書‧江充傳》：「燒鐵鉗灼，強服之。」顏師古注：「以燒鐵或鉗之，或灼之。鉗，鑷也。」 「 鉗 」還指夾東西的工具。唐柳宗元〈乞巧文〉：「膠加鉗夾，誓死無遷。」
From the sound of " gold" and " gan", the original meaning is an iron ring that binds the neck, which is a kind of ancient torture instrument. "Shuowen": "With iron, there is a robbery. From the gold, the sound is sweet." "Old Tang Book-Criminal Law History": "It is also a prisoner's tool, including flail, loquat, pincers, and locks, all of which are long and short. Narrow system." " Tweezers" can mean the penalty of using an iron ring to tie the neck. "The Biography of Ji Bu Luan Bu in the Records of the History": "The tongs of Ji cloth, the brown clothes, and the canton willow car." " Clamp" also means compulsion. "Huainanzi: Spirit": "Pinch the harmony of yin and yang, and the feeling of compelling life, so lifelong sadness." " Clamping" also means to clamp and restrain. "Zhuangzi‧ Tianzifang": "My form is unresolved and I don't want to move, and I don't want to speak with my mouth." " Pliers" can also refer to gripping. "Han Shu·Jiang Chong Biography": "Burning iron with tongs, then force it." Yan Shigu's note: "Use burning iron or tongs, or burn it. Forceps, tongs. " Pliers" also refer to tools for gripping things. Tang Liu Zongyuan "Qiao Wen": "Glue and clamp, swear to death without change."

鉗字的基本解释

鉗
qián
见“钳”。

鉗字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qián］
［《廣韻》巨淹切，平鹽，羣。］
“钳1”的繁体字。
(1)古刑具。束颈的铁圈。
(2)古刑罚。以铁器钳束人的颈项、手、足。
(3)钳持，缄禁。
(4)引申为威慑。
(5)恶劣。
(6)夹，夹取。
(7)用来夹持小型工件，弯曲或切断金属丝的一种工具。可分为尖口钳、平口钳和鲤鱼钳等。
(8)节肢动物的螯。

鉗字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鉗； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1301第14
【唐韻】巨淹切【集韻】【韻會】其淹切，?音箝。【說文】以鐵有所刼束也。从金甘聲。【前漢·高帝紀】自髠鉗爲王家奴。【註】鉗，以鐵束頸也。【後漢·光武紀】弛解鉗衣。【註】倉頡篇曰：鉗，釱也。釱足鉗。又【五行志】廣漢鉗子謀攻牢。【師古註】鉗子，謂鉗徒也。【晉律】鉗重二斤，翹長一尺五寸。【集韻】或作鉆。　又銸也。【後漢·梁冀傳】妻孫壽，性鉗忌。【註】鉗，取也。言性忌害如鉗之能銸物也。　又【揚子·方言】惡也。南楚，凡人殘罵謂之鉗。　又【家語】無取鉗鉗。【註】鉗鉗，妄行不誠也。　又【呂氏春秋】後時者，小莖而麻長，短穗而厚糠小米，鉗而不香。　又澤名。【張衡·南都賦】其陂澤則有鉗盧玉池。　又姓。【正字通】唐元和中長令鉗耳。　又與拑通。【後漢·袁紹傳】道路以目，百辟鉗口。【註】以木銜其口也。或作拑。渠廉反。　又【集韻】其嚴切，音黔。義同。　又【集韻】五甘切，音玵。刃也。

考證：〔又鋷也。【後漢·梁冀傳】妻孫壽，性鉗忌。【註】鉗

clamp
Basic explanation of words
clamp
qián
See "clamp".
clamp
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qián］
["Guangyun" giant flooded cut, flat salt, group. ]
Traditional characters for "Clamp 1".
(1) Ancient instruments of torture. The iron ring to tie the neck.
(2) Ancient penalty. Use iron tongs to tie a person's neck, hands, and feet.
(3) Clamp and restrain.
(4) The extension is deterrence.
(5) Bad.
(6) Clamp, clamp and take.
(7) A tool used to clamp small workpieces and bend or cut metal wires. It can be divided into sharp-nose pliers, flat-nose pliers and slip joint pliers.
(8) Arthropod claws.
clamp
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Su Ji 1】【Golden Word Department】　pliers; Kangxi strokes: 13; Page number: page 1301-14
[Tang Yun] Juyan cut [Ji Yun] [Yunhui] Its drown cut, sound pliers. [Said the text] There is also a sash with iron. From the sound of Jin Gan. [Pre-Han · Gao Di Ji] Since the tongs were Wang's slaves. [Note] Pliers, tie the neck with iron. [Later Han·Guangwu Ji] To relax the tongs. [Note] The Cangjie chapter says: Clamp, Jie Ye. Foot pliers. Also【Five Elements】Guanghan Pliers seek to attack. [Shigu Note] Pliers are also called pliers. [Jin law] The pliers weigh two catties and are one foot and five inches long. [Ji Yun] Or as a drill.　Yeah again. [Later Han·Liang Ji Biography] Wife Sun Shou, sex clamp. [Note] Clamp, take it. Words avoid harm like pliers.　[Yangtze Dialect] Also evil. Nanchu, mortal abuse is called the forceps.　[Family language] No tongs. [Note] Clamping forceps is also impertinent.　[Lu Shi Chunqiu] Later, small stems and long hemp, short ears and thick bran millet, tongs but not fragrant.　Also known as Ze. 【Zhang Heng·Nandu Fu】Qi Pize has clamp Lu Yuchi.　Another last name. [Zhengzitong] Tang Yuanhe Zhongchang Lingqiang ears.　Connect with Clamp again. [The Story of Yuan Shao in the Later Han Dynasty] The road is in sight, and every jaw is opened. [Note] The mouth is also held by wood. Or make pliers. Qu Lian opposed.　[Jiyun] It’s strict and sound. The same meaning.　[Jiyun] Five Gan cuts, sound 玵. Blade also. Textual research: 〔Yes again. [Later Han·Liang Ji Biography] Wife Sun Shou, sex clamp. 【Note】Pliers
